channel.title: JavaScript Weekly
channel.description: A newsletter of JavaScript articles, news and cool projects

item.title: „ÄêTC39: No to records and tuples, yes to enums„ÄëTC39ÔºöÂê¶ËÆ∞ÂΩïÂíåÂÖÉÁ¥†ÔºåÊòØÁöÑ
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã732 ‚Äî April 18, 2025

Read on the Web

ü•ö A Good Friday, if you celebrate Easter at all. We're taking a little break but didn't want to take the entire week off, so we have a slimline issue for you today¬†:-) We'll be back to full service next¬†Friday!
__
Peter Cooper, your editor

JavaScript Weekly

The ECMAScript Records and Tuples Proposal Has Been Withdrawn ‚Äî Several years in the making, the record and tuples proposal offered two new deeply immutable data structures to JavaScript, but at this week‚Äôs TC39 meeting, the consensus was to drop¬†it.

There have, however, been some more positive updates:

  • A proposal for introducing enums to JavaScript has advanced to stage 1. It seeks the adoption of a compatible form of TypeScript's enum declaration. Slidedeck here.

  • The Deferred re-exports proposal has advanced to stage 2. There's a slidedeck walking through the feature.

  • The Upsert and Composites proposals have been¬†advanced.

It's worth following Rob Palmer if you want to keep up to date with TC39 goings-on as he's always sharing the latest¬†news.

Plug & Play Image Editor For Your Web App ‚Äî Save yourself the headache of building an image editor. Import the pintura module, give it an image source, and instantly get features like cropping, rotating, resizing, and annotation. Need help? Support has you covered. Try it for free¬†today.

Pintura sponsor

Hako: A New High-Performance Embeddable JavaScript Engine ‚Äî A fork of PrimJS (which is, itself, built on top of QuickJS) that compiles down to WebAssembly and can act as a portable, embeddable JavaScript engine for other apps (here‚Äôs an example of using it in a Go¬†app).

Andrew Sampson

IN BRIEF:

  • Mozilla has enabled its Temporal implementation by default as of Firefox 139.

  • üìò Dr. Axel Rauschmayer has released Exploring TypeScript: TS 5.8 edition, a book bringing together all of his recent research into modern TypeScript development. You can buy the book but also read it all online for free in HTML form, if you¬†prefer.

  • ESLint has added support for 'bulk suppressions', a way to make adopting stricter linting rules more¬†manageable.

  • Dan Abramov is back with JSX Over The Wire, a fantastic meditation on the evolution of passing data and behavior between servers and clients and how things could get even¬†better.

  • ü§ñ Microsoft's Burke Holland ‚ñ∂Ô∏è shows off VS Code's new 'agent mode' feature which really makes Copilot far more powerful and a fine alternative to dedicated AI-powered¬†editors. I've been using it a lot this¬†week.

  • Google has made Firebase App Hosting generally available. It offers a streamlined, fully-managed deployment process for Angular and Next.js¬†apps.

  • Sacha Greif, the name behind the State of JavaScript survey, has just launched the first 'State of Devs' survey. üó≥Ô∏è You can fill it out here.

RELEASES:

  • Astro 5.7 ‚Äì The popular content framework gains an experimental fonts API, its sessions API is now stable, and there's support for using local SVG files as¬†components.

  • WebStorm 2025.1 ‚Äì JetBrains' JavaScript IDE ‚Äì fresh with big AI, Angular, monorepo, and Next.js enhancements.

  • tldts 7.0 ‚Äì URL parsing library to extract domains, subdomains, suffixes,¬†etc.

  • gridstack.js 12.0 ‚Äì Build responsive interactive dashboards¬†quickly.

  • Lexe ‚Äì Package a Node app into a single, small executable.

  • DOCX 9.4 ‚Äì Generate Word documents from¬†JavaScript.

  • Redux Toolkit 2.7, Bun v1.2.10, Babylon.js 8.3, Rambda 10.0

üìñ¬† Articles and Videos

A Flowing WebGL Gradient, Deconstructed ‚Äî Even if you don‚Äôt want to render a neat plasma-style effect on the Web, this is a wonderfully deep exploration of the math and technology behind doing so using simple GLSL code that could be easily understood by any JavaScript¬†developer.

Alex Harri

üí° If you like stuff like this, this CodePen of a GLSL-based swirl effect is neat¬†too.

Advanced React in the Wild ‚Äî A round-up of case studies showing how five different engineering teams have pushed React to the limit in production and their real-world wins in areas like performance, Core Web Vitals, caching, and more. A lot to enjoy¬†here.

Addy Osmani and Hassan Djirdeh

üì∫ Building Single Page Apps with SvelteKit ‚Äì And not only that, you can create SvelteKit apps in a single HTML file that can run without a Web server. (15¬†minutes) Stanislav Khromov

üìÑ How I Track My Blog‚Äôs Analytics with Val Town Orestis Papadopoulos

üìÑ Deploying TypeScript: Recent Advances and Possible Future Directions Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

üìÑ Zero-Config Debugging with Deno and OpenTelemetry Casonato and Jiang (Deno)

üìÑ Creating an AI Chat Experience with React and OpenAI Robin Wieruch

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>
Âú®ÁΩë‰∏äÈòÖËØª

ü•öÂ¶ÇÊûúÊÇ®Â∫ÜÁ•ùÂ§çÊ¥ªËäÇÔºå‰∏Ä‰∏™ËÄ∂Á®£ÂèóÈöæÊó•„ÄÇ We're taking a little break but didn't want to take the entire week off, so we have a slimline issue for you today¬†:-) We'll be back to full service next¬†Friday!
__
Peter Cooper, your editor

- Âç≥‰ΩøÊÇ®‰∏çÊÉ≥Âú®ÁΩëÁªú‰∏äÂëàÁé∞Êï¥Ê¥ÅÁöÑÁ≠âÁ¶ªÂ≠ê‰ΩìÂºèÊïàÊûúÔºåËøôÊòØÂØπ‰ΩøÁî®ÁÆÄÂçïÁöÑGLSL‰ª£Á†ÅËøõË°åÁöÑÊï∞Â≠¶ÂíåÊäÄÊúØÁöÑÂ•áÂ¶ôÊ∑±ÂàªÊé¢Á¥¢Ôºå‰ªª‰ΩïJavaScriptÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫ÂëòÈÉΩÂèØ‰ª•ÂæàÂÆπÊòìÂú∞ÁêÜËß£„ÄÇ

Alex Harri

üí°Â¶ÇÊûúÊÇ®ÂñúÊ¨¢ËøôÊ†∑ÁöÑ‰∏úË•øÔºå

- Ê°à‰æãÁ†îÁ©∂ÁöÑÁªºËø∞ÔºåË°®Êòé‰∫î‰∏™‰∏çÂêåÁöÑÂ∑•Á®ãÂõ¢ÈòüÂ¶Ç‰ΩïÂ∞ÜPRÁöÑÈôêÂà∂ÂèçÂ∫îÂú®Áª©ÊïàÔºåÊ†∏ÂøÉÁΩëÁªúÁîüÂëΩÂäõÔºåÁºìÂ≠òÁ≠âÈ¢ÜÂüüÔºåËµ∑‰ºèÂèäÂÖ∂Áé∞ÂÆû‰∏ñÁïåÂ∞ÜËµ¢ÂæóËÉúÂà©„ÄÇËøôÈáåÊúâÂæàÂ§ö‰∫´Âèó„ÄÇ

Addy OsmaniÂíåHassan Djirdeh

üì∫Ôºà15ÂàÜÈíüÔºâ stanislav khromov

item.title: „ÄêBring back the fun with p5.js 2.0„ÄëÁî®P5.JS 2.0Â∏¶Âõû‰πêË∂£
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã733 ‚Äî April 25, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

p5.js 2.0: The JavaScript Library for Creative Coding ‚Äî A popular Processing-inspired creative coding library that makes it easy to create interactive, visual experiences (examples). v2.0 improves its font support, adds more ways to draw and manipulate text, adds a way to write shaders in JavaScript, and much more. p5.js 2.0: You Are Here has more details on the release and where the project is headed¬†next.

p5.js Team

üí° p5.js is simultaneously useful and fun. It provides a great abstraction for interactive, visual experiences and is easy to play with using its online editor. A pastime of mine is asking AI models to create demos. For example, load this p5.js sketch and hit play to see a JS logo glitch experiment OpenAI's o3 just made for¬†me.

Unbork Your Laravel App (Live) ‚Äî Laravel is so in right now. Join us for a hands-on debugging session using a demo app, Unborked. We‚Äôll track errors, replay sessions, trace slowdowns, and maybe even let the robots help. Bring your¬†bugs.

Sentry sponsor

Big Updates in the React World ‚Äî You know it‚Äôs been a big week in the React world when the React Compiler hitting Release Candidate is the second most important story. In this latest React Labs post, we learn about two new features ready to try out today in react@experimental: View Transitions and the <Activity> component.

Ricky Hanlon

IN BRIEF:

  • SolidJS creator Ryan Carniato reflects on a decade running the SolidJS project, four years after hitting v1.0.

  • Back in March, the Node.js project suffered a security incident relating to its CI/testing setup. They've now written up the details of what¬†happened.

  • With Deno 2.3 just around the corner, the Deno team shares a few updates on recent improvements.

RELEASES:

  • ‚≠ê pnpm 10.9 ‚Äì The alternative, efficient package¬†manager. It can now be used to install JSR¬†packages.

  • jsvu 3.0 ‚Äì Tool to install versions of various JavaScript¬†engines.

  • SmallJS 1.6 ‚Äì A Smalltalk-80 implementation that runs in¬†JavaScript.

  • Bun v1.2.10, Node.js v22.15.0 (LTS), Next.js 15.4 Canary

üìñ¬† Articles

Creating a 3D Split-Flap Display with JavaScript ‚Äî A split-flap display is a electro-mechanical display commonly associated with live timetable displays and it makes for a neat effect on the Web too. Jhey breaks down how to replicate it, or you can hit up this live¬†demo.

Jhey Tompkins

Impossible Components ‚Äî Dan Abramov digs into the idea of so-called ‚Äòimpossible‚Äô components that mix server-only and client-only features and how React Server Components can help bridge the divide, culminating in an example you can experiment with for¬†yourself.

Dan Abramov

How to Build a Multi-Tenant App Using Clerk + Supabase ‚Äî Clerk and Supabase empower you to build B2B apps with only a few small changes to your codebase. Learn how in this¬†guide.

Clerk sponsor

Optimizing Node Performance with V8 GC Optimization ‚Äî Matteo recently ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†gave a talk about Node‚Äôs memory usage and has written it up into this blog post. He notes that high memory usage doesn‚Äôt necessarily mean you have a memory leak, explains how V8‚Äôs garbage collection works, and how to tune things for your own use¬†case.

Matteo Collina

Abusing DuckDB-WASM by Making SQL Draw 3D Graphics (Sort Of) ‚Äî Oh, this is a fun experiment. DuckDB is a small and powerful in-process SQL database (think SQLite but for analytical tasks) and has a native WebAssembly build. Couple that with some JavaScript, and you too could do some rather bizarre¬†things..

Patrick Trainer

üí° Lest you think this is just a fun item, you could use the techniques learnt here to integrate DuckDB more seriously into other Web¬†projects.

üìÑ A Decade of Impact: How Our npm Packages Hit 1 Billion Downloads and Shaped JavaScript ‚Äì A bold title for sure, but with a neat story behind¬†it. Forward Email

üìÑ Float16Array in JavaScript ‚Äì Understanding the 16-bit floating point array type. Trevor I. Lasn

üìÑ When to Use map() vs. forEach() Matt Smith

üìÑ Zero-Config Debugging with Deno and OpenTelemetry Casonato and Jiang (Deno)

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

JavaScript Font Picker ‚Äî A surprisingly featureful control for letting users pick fonts from a range of system fonts, Google fonts, and custom fonts of your choice. You can play with a code demo here or go to the GitHub¬†repo.

Zygomatic

üé® The folks behind this project have also built JS Color Picker.

Scala.js 1.19.0: A Way to Bring Scala and JavaScript Together ‚Äî Scala is a powerful language that never quite seemed to make it big to me, but it has a devoted fanbase and has grown beyond its JVM roots to also have JavaScript and native runtimes. Scala.js is a Scala to JavaScript compiler and the homepage has some neat code and feature¬†comparisons.

Scala.js Team

Penpot Launches Native Design Tokens! ‚Äî Simplify your design & code collaboration with Penpot design tokens: the key to consistency and¬†scalability.

Penpot sponsor

Spectacle: Create Sleek React-Powered Presentations ‚Äî A React-based library for creating sleek presentations using JSX syntax that gives you the ability to live demo your code, add interactive elements, scrollable code blocks, graphics effects, and¬†more.

Nearform

Frimousse: A Lightweight, Unstyled, and Composable Emoji Picker for¬†React ‚Äî The picker is accessible and won‚Äôt display any emojis that aren‚Äôt supported on the device. You can explore some demos¬†here.

liveblocks

  • c15t (Consent Management) ‚Äì A React approach to transforming privacy consent from a mere checkbox into a fully observable¬†system.

  • bignumber.js 9.3 ‚Äì Arbitrary-precision decimal and non-decimal¬†arithmetic.

  • Milkdown 7.9 ‚Äì Plugin-driven WYSIWYG Markdown editor¬†framework.

  • Koota 0.4 ‚Äì Performant real-time ECS-based state¬†management.

  • tablesort 5.6 ‚Äì Plain JS table row sorting¬†mechanism.

  • üì∫ React Lite YouTube Embed 2.5

  • ESLint v9.25.1

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

‚úâÔ∏è FYI: We publish two other JavaScript related newsletters if you work with Node.js or React: Node Weekly and React Status.

üì¢¬† Elsewhere

A quick roundup of other interesting updates and useful resources from across the broader developer¬†landscape:

  • ü§î The Microsoft Edge team is looking for feedback on a new console.context() method to enable "helpful contextual logging" within the¬†devtools.

  • üî≠ David Cummings of the Jet Propulsion Laboratory gave a talk about ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†how they diagnosed and fixed a problem on the Voyager 1 space probe while it was 15 billion miles away. If you ever think debugging a local app is difficult, this is next¬†level.

  • üîê The maximum lifetime of TLS certificates is set to be reduced to 47 days in a gradual process between early 2026 and 2029.

  • ü§Ø Google may be forced to sell Chrome, and guess who's interested in buying¬†it?¬†OpenAI, among others.

  • TIL you can interact with GitHub's GraphQL API with the GitHub CLI tool.

„Äë
>>>>>>>>>

Âú®ÁΩë‰∏äÈòÖËØª

How to Build a Multi-Tenant App Using Clerk + Supabase ‚Äî Clerk and Supabase empower you to build B2B apps with only a few smallÊõ¥ÊîπÊÇ®ÁöÑ‰ª£Á†ÅÂ∫ì„ÄÇ Â≠¶‰π†Â¶Ç‰ΩïÂú®Êú¨ÊåáÂçó‰∏≠„ÄÇ

Â∫óÂëò

- ÊúÄËøëMatteo ‚ñ∂quate quate ÂØπNodeÁöÑËÆ∞ÂøÜËøõË°å‰∫ÜËÆ®ËÆ∫ÔºåÂπ∂Â∞ÜÂÖ∂ÂÜôÂÖ•‰∫ÜÊú¨ÂçöÂÆ¢ÊñáÁ´†‰∏≠„ÄÇ‰ªñÊåáÂá∫ÔºåÈ´òÂÜÖÂ≠ò‰ΩøÁî®ÊÉÖÂÜµÂπ∂‰∏ç‰∏ÄÂÆöÊÑèÂë≥ÁùÄÊÇ®ÊúâËÆ∞ÂøÜÊ≥ÑÊºèÔºåËß£Èáä‰∫ÜV8ÁöÑÂûÉÂúæÊî∂ÈõÜÁöÑÂ∑•‰ΩúÂéüÁêÜ‰ª•ÂèäÂ¶Ç‰Ωï‰∏∫ÊÇ®Ëá™Â∑±ÁöÑÁî®‰æãË∞ÉÊï¥ÂÜÖÂÆπ„ÄÇ

Matteo Collina

- Âì¶ÔºåËøôÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊúâË∂£ÁöÑÂÆûÈ™å„ÄÇ duckdb ÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™Â∞èÂûã‰∏îÂäüËÉΩÂº∫Â§ßÁöÑÁ®ãÂ∫èÂÜÖSQLÊï∞ÊçÆÂ∫ìÔºàThink Sqlite sqlite sqlite sqliteÔºå‰ΩÜÁî®‰∫éÂàÜÊûê‰ªªÂä°ÔºâÔºåÂπ∂‰∏îÂÖ∑ÊúâÊú¨Êú∫ÁöÑWebAssemblyÊûÑÂª∫„ÄÇÂ∞ÜÂÖ∂‰∏é‰∏Ä‰∫õJavaScriptÁõ∏ÁªìÂêàÔºåÊÇ®‰πüÂèØ‰ª•ÂÅö‰∏Ä‰∫õÁõ∏ÂΩìÂ•áÊÄ™ÁöÑ‰∫ãÊÉÖ„ÄÇ

Â∏ïÁâπÈáåÂÖãÊïôÁªÉ

üí°Ôºå‰ª•ÂÖçÊÇ®ËÆ§‰∏∫ËøôÊòØ‰∏Ä‰∏™ÊúâË∂£ÁöÑÈ°πÁõÆÔºåÊÇ®ÂèØ‰ª•Âú®Ê≠§Â§Ñ‰ΩøÁî®ÁöÑÊäÄÊúØÂ∞ÜDuckDBÊõ¥Âä†ËÆ§ÁúüÂú∞ÈõÜÊàêÂà∞ÂÖ∂‰ªñWebÈ°πÁõÆ‰∏≠„ÄÇ

üìÑËΩ¨ÂèëÁîµÂ≠êÈÇÆ‰ª∂

üìÑ trevor I. lasn

üìÑüìÑ

üì¢ÂÖ∂‰ªñÂú∞Êñπ

‰ªéÊõ¥ÂπøÊ≥õÁöÑÂºÄÂèë‰∫∫ÂëòÊôØËßÇ‰∏≠ÁöÑÂÖ∂‰ªñÊúâË∂£ÁöÑÊõ¥Êñ∞ÂíåÊúâÁî®ÁöÑËµÑÊ∫êËøõË°åÂø´ÈÄüÁªºËø∞Ôºö

  • ü§îMicrosoftEdgeÂõ¢ÈòüÊ≠£Âú®ÂØªÊâæ

  • üî≠Â§ßÂç´¬∑Âç°ÊòéÊñØÔºàDavid CummingsÔºâRyÂèëË°®‰∫ÜÂÖ≥‰∫é

  • üîê

  • ü§ØÂèØËÉΩË¢´Ëø´Ë¢´Ëø´Âá∫ÂîÆChromeÔºåÂπ∂‰∏î

  • ÊÇ®ÂèØ‰ª•

item.title: „ÄêMaking V8 eager to compile your JavaScript„Äë‰ΩøV8Ê∏¥ÊúõÁºñËØëÊÇ®ÁöÑJavaScript
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã734 ‚Äî May 2, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

GSAP v3.13: JavaScript Animation Set Free ‚Äî Last year the popular GSAP (a.k.a. GreenSock) animation library was acquired by Webflow and as of this new version the entire GSAP toolkit is freely available (including formerly paid addons like MorphSVG and SplitText) even for commercial¬†use. If you're unfamiliar with GSAP and want to see some of what it can do, they have a showcase, lots of code¬†demos, and amazing¬†docs.

Cassie Evans and Jack Doyle

üí° Take care with the license though. GSAP is not formally 'open source' but has a ‚Äòno charge‚Äô license that prevents you using it to directly compete with Webflow.

AG Charts: The Best JavaScript Charting Library in the World ‚Äî Create beautiful JavaScript Charts in minutes with our open-source library. Built by AG Grid, AG Charts has an intuitive, flexible API, 20+ series types and advanced features, including Financial Charts. Supports React, Angular & Vue. Try for¬†free.

AG Charts sponsor

Converting Values to Strings in JavaScript ‚Äî When Dr. Axel says ‚Äúconverting values to strings in JavaScript is more complicated than it might seem‚Äù, I‚Äôm inclined to believe him. An interesting poke about into something seemingly simple you might not think about very¬†much.

Dr. Axel Rauschmayer

üìâ¬†Giving V8 a Heads-Up: Faster Startup with Explicit Compile Hints ‚Äî A look at a V8 optimization that lets you direct V8 to eagerly compile specific files as a way to speed up startup. It ships with Chrome¬†136 and the performance gains are more compelling than you might¬†expect.

Marja H√∂ltt√§

IN BRIEF:

  • Node.js's releases are currently shifting around a little. v18 has just gone 'end of life', v23 has entered 'maintenance' mode and v24 is soon to land as the new 'current'¬†release.

  • ü§† jQuery was first released in 2006 and to celebrate its 20th anniversary, there's a jQuery Reunion event in Texas on January 16-17,¬†2026.

  • The Svelte team has a look at what's new in Svelte lately, and the Astro team has a similar update for Astro too.

  • You can now install JSR packages with pnpm and Yarn.

  • Learn about JavaScript's numerous operators with a handy online reference.

RELEASES:

  • Deno 2.3 ‚Äì The alternative JavaScript runtime improves its single binary compilation feature to support FFI and Node native¬†addons.

  • Prisma 6.7 ‚Äì Popular ORM for Node.js and¬†TypeScript.

  • Bun v1.2.11, Electron 36, pnpm 10.10

üìñ¬† Articles

Export Google Analytics Data to Google Sheets via Apps Script ‚Äî Google Apps Script is a JavaScript-based platform for dynamically automating tasks in all sorts of Google apps. Here‚Äôs how to use it to bring Google Analytics data into a Google¬†Sheet.

Kayce Basques

Building an Offline-Friendly Image Upload System ‚Äî How to leverage PWA tech such as IndexedDB, service workers, and the Background Sync API to help improve the reliability of web apps for users, particularly those with unreliable internet¬†connectivity.

Amejimaobari Ollornwi

How to Take Clerk to Production ‚Äî How to take a Clerk app to production with custom domains, OAuth credentials, and DNS¬†setup.

Clerk sponsor

What Does React's 'use client' Do? ‚Äî Dan Abramov takes a practical look at how to think about the use client and use server directives React Server Components introduced and how they let you elegantly structure a client/server app as ‚Äúa single program spanning two environments‚Äù ‚Äì a concept that Dan thinks could be more widely used, even outside of¬†React.

Dan Abramov

üìÑ Deno‚Äôs Decline? ‚Äì A critical view of Deno‚Äôs Deno Deploy edge platform which has been steadily dropping¬†regions. David Bushell

üì∫ How to Detect Memory Leaks in Your Web App Decoded Frontend

üìÑ Pwning the Ladybird Browser ‚Äì The vector is Ladybird‚Äôs LibJS JavaScript¬†engine. Jess

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

PDFSlick 3.0: View and Interact with PDF Documents in JS Apps ‚Äî A full-featured PDF viewer for React, Solid, Svelte and vanilla JS apps. Built on top of PDF.js, it offers a wide array of features from simple PDF viewing to working with multiple and large documents with annotations. Demo. v3.0 bumps up to PDF.js v5 with ICC profile support, better JPEG 2000 support, and improved rendering of large¬†pages.

Vancho Stojkov

Koa 3.0: The Expressive HTTP Middleware Framework ‚Äî Koa first appeared a decade ago as a ‚Äònext-generation‚Äô Web framework that shared some of the lineage of Express.js, but leaning on more modern JS features. While Express has been making a comeback, Koa remains a compelling¬†alternative.

Koa contributors

Your Terminal, Evolved ‚Äî The new agentic CLI from AWS works with you to write files locally, run bash commands, or call AWS APIs. Start for¬†free!

Amazon sponsor

Seyfert: A Framework for Building Discord Bots ‚Äî Create bots for the popular chat system starting from bots that respond to simple commands up to creating components and getting user input. Supports Deno, Bun, and Node.

socram03

Storybook 9 Beta ‚Äî A strong step forward for the UI ‚Äòfrontend workshop‚Äô with several experimental features from Storybook 8 becoming stable. v9 has a strong focus on component testing, plus React Native¬†support.

Michael Shilman

PGlite 0.3: Postgres but in WebAssembly ‚Äî A WebAssembly-based build of the Postgres SQL database meaning you can run it wherever WebAssembly can be run (such as in the browser as in this¬†demo).

ElectricSQL

  • pretty-bytes 7.0 ‚Äì Convert a size in bytes into a human readable¬†equivalent (e.g. 1337 ‚Üí 1.34¬†kB).

  • QuickJS 2.2 ‚Äì Execute JavaScript code in a WebAssembly QuickJS¬†sandbox.

  • Piscina 5.0 ‚Äì Popular Node.js worker thread¬†pool.

  • Jira.js 5.0 ‚Äì A wrapper for Jira's numerous¬†APIs.

  • NodeBB 4.3 ‚Äì Node.js-powered forum¬†system.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

üéπ STRICH: Add blazing fast and reliable 1D/2D Barcode Scanning to your web apps. Free demo app and 30-day trial¬†available.

üì¢¬† Elsewhere

A quick roundup of other interesting updates and useful resources from across the broader developer¬†landscape:

  • Redis is open source again! The popular Redis in-memory data store ran into a bit of drama in recent years with a license change following its acquisition. The good news is that an AGPL license is now an option for the new Redis 8 release making Redis truly 'open source again.'

  • TypeScript ‚Üê‚Üí C#: I've been dabbling with a little C# recently (it's the main language used in Unity game development) and enjoyed this TypeScript is Like C# guide oriented largely around showing TypeScript/JavaScript vs C# examples of doing the same¬†things.

  • ‚ù§Ô∏è JS + HTML: It's a simple thing, but Simon Willison reminds us that static HTML enriched with JavaScript and served up on GitHub Pages is one of the best ways you can give software freely for the world to use.

  • Emulators-a-plenty: Tiny Emus is a showcase of almost 200 emulators that run in the browser, largely for 8 bit platforms, games, and even some visual CPU¬†demos.

  • CSS shapes: Did you know CSS now has a shape() function for drawing complex shapes for clipping paths?

„Äë

item.title: „ÄêBig Node, VS Code, and Mantine updates„ÄëÂ§ßËäÇÁÇπÔºåvs‰ª£Á†ÅÂíåÂ£ÅÁÇâÊõ¥Êñ∞
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã735 ‚Äî May 9, 2025

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

k6 1.0: Go-Powered Load Testing with JavaScript ‚Äî A full-featured, configurable load generation tool that uses the Sobek Go-powered JavaScript engine to support writing test scripts in JavaScript. v1.0 promises stability, first-class TypeScript support, and better¬†extensibility.

Grafana Labs

JSON-Powered White-Label Form Builder for Your JavaScript App ‚Äî Build dynamic JSON-driven forms in your JavaScript application with SurveyJS ‚Äî a fully customizable, drag-and-drop form-building UI component. It integrates seamlessly with React, Angular, and Vue 3, and has no backend limitations. Perfect for form-heavy¬†apps.

SurveyJS sponsor

Node 24 (Current) Released ‚Äî Node‚Äôs release lines are shifting a little lately ‚Äì v18 has gone EOL and now v23 gives way to v24 as the ‚ÄòCurrent‚Äô release for when you need the cutting edge features. It comes with npm 11, V8 13.6 (hello RegExp.escape, Float16Array, and Error.isError), the URLPattern API exposed by default, plus Undici¬†7.

Node.js Team

üí° Technically, Node v24.0.1 is the latest version temporarily reintroducing an EOL feature due to breakages in popular¬†dependencies.

Visual Studio Code Version 1.100 ‚Äî Not to be confused with a 1.1 release, this update to VS Code has quite a few goodies for JavaScript developers with improved ‚ÄòNext Edit Suggestions‚Äô that will suggest adding missing imports, support for Node‚Äôs enhanced network debugging capabilities, improved visibility of type information, remote MCP server support, GPT 4.1 as the new default base model, and¬†more.

Microsoft

IN BRIEF:

  • The Node.js team is keen for you to take the latest Node.js Next 10 survey to help guide Node's future¬†priorities.

  • Polycompiler uses a cute trick to let you merge Python and JavaScript into the same source¬†file.

  • The OpenJS Foundation has announced its new board of directors.

RELEASES:

  • ü§ñ ESLint v9.26.0 ‚Äì An interesting release for the popular static analysis tool as it adds support for MCP as a way for ESLint to be used directly by AI models and coding¬†agents.

  • üóæ Mapbox GL JS 3.12 ‚Äì Interactive, customizable vector maps in the browser, rendered with¬†WebGL.

  • Relay v19 ‚Äì Facebook's declarative React/GraphQL¬†framework.

  • Material UI 7.1 ‚Äì React components using Material¬†Design. Now Tailwind CSS¬†4¬†compatible

  • Rspack 1.3.9, Babylon.js 8.7, Electron 36 (official blog¬†post)

üìñ¬† Articles

The Power of the Spread and Rest Syntax ‚Äî A quick run through the opportunities opened up with just three little dots ...

Matt Smith

React Server Components for Astro Developers ‚Äî Astro‚Äôs ‚Äòisland‚Äô architecture and React Server Components share a strikingly similar mental model. Dan compares the two, digs into some of the quirks, and suggests Astro offers a ‚Äògentler onramp‚Äô to some of RSC‚Äôs ideas if you‚Äôre struggling with¬†them.

Dan Abramov

Wallaby MCP: Deep Runtime Context for Your AI Agent ‚Äî Wallaby gives your AI agent live execution data, dynamic coverage, and real-time insights to fix and generate tests, and write code with¬†confidence.

Wallaby Team sponsor

Migrating a Project from Prettier and ESLint to Biome ‚Äî Prettier and ESLint are staples in many JavaScript build processes, but Biome offers an interesting ‚Äòone stop shop‚Äô alternative.

Damilola Olatunji

üìÑ 'Electron Ain't Bad, Actually' ‚Äì Worth re-reading next time you see the clich√©d criticisms of¬†Electron. Vaxry

üì∫ The React Compiler Explained in Three Minutes Better Stack

üìÑ You're Misunderstanding DDD in Angular Tomasz Ducin

üìÑ The Story of Fastify + Vue Jonas Galvez

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

HelloCSV: A Drop-In, CSV Importing Workflow for JS Apps ‚Äî If you or your users have CSV files to import, here‚Äôs a complete CSV importing workflow for the frontend that you can drop into your app. Basic¬†docs.

HelloCSV

PptxGenJS 4.0: Build PowerPoint Presentations with JavaScript ‚Äî A mature library that outputs standards-compliant Open Office XML files compatible with PowerPoint, Apple Keynote, and other common presentation tools. Supports graphics, text, tables, and other typical slide objects. Lots of¬†demos.

Brent Ely

Introducing Clerk Billing ‚Äî Clerk Billing lets you add B2C/B2B subscriptions with no payment code or UI work‚Äîjust drop in components and¬†go.

Clerk sponsor

Mantine 8.0: The Full Featured React Components Library ‚Äî Mantine is one of the most celebrated React components libraries, and for good reason: it‚Äôs full featured, modern, and looks great. v8.0 ups its chart game with a little Recharts magic, adds over twenty new components (including a GitHub-style Heatmap, Tree and SemiCircleProgress), submenus, and much¬†more.

Vitaly Rtishchev et al.

Hyparquet: Parquet File Parser for JavaScript ‚Äî Parquet is a popular column-oriented data file format frequently used for storing large datasets for analysis. Hyparquet is a dependency-free JavaScript library for working with Parquet files, even in the browser (as in this¬†demo).

Hyperparam

üîä¬†react-sounds: Add Sound Effects to React Apps ‚Äî Having sound effects on the Web might sound like your idea of a nightmare, but this is a well put together project with delicate, well thought out examples that strike the right¬†tone.

Aedilic Inc.

mono-jsx: <html> as a Response ‚Äî A server-side JSX runtime that renders <html> to a Response with no build step needed and works across numerous server-side JS¬†runtimes.

Je Xia

  • Prisma v6.7 ‚Äì The popular ORM's attempts to move away from Rust to TypeScript are picking up¬†pace.

  • Slack Send GitHub Action 2.1 ‚Äì Send data into Slack from GitHub¬†Actions.

  • openid-client 6.5 ‚Äì OAuth 2/OpenID Connect client API for JS¬†runtimes.

  • üìÑ DOCX 9.5 ‚Äì Generate Word documents from¬†JavaScript.

  • eslint-plugin-prettier 5.4 ‚Äì Runs Prettier as an ESLint¬†rule.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meticulous automatically creates and maintains an E2E UI test suite with zero developer effort. Relied on by Dropbox, Wiz, Lattice, Bilt Rewards,¬†etc.

üïπÔ∏è Craft delightful games that change how the world learns as an engineer at Brilliant. Remote/NYC/SF:¬†brilliant.org/careers/

üëÄ¬† Elsewhere..

Here's a selection of things from the broader ecosystem we've noticed this week:

  • The CSS Overflow 5 spec enables the creation of pure CSS scroll and 'carousel' experiences on the Web, and Sara Soueidan has dug in deep and done an accessibility and usability analysis of the feature. Is it time to give up your JavaScript-based approach? Not yet, says¬†Sara.

  • Sam Rose is back with another fantastic visual essay - this time looking at 'reservoir sampling.' As well as getting to learn a useful programming technique in a visual way, you can also check out all the JavaScript code he built that powers the¬†article.

  • One team decided to move away from Next.js and migrate to Ruby on Rails, while still maintaining a React frontend ‚Äì here's their tale of why and how.

  • Postgres 18 Beta 1 was released. IO performance on Linux is a big¬†focus. The final release is due in September or¬†October.

  • ü§ñ Google has updated its Gemini 2.5 Pro model ‚Äì they claim it's now far better at building frontend apps in particular with 'a real taste for aesthetic web¬†development'.

P.S. If you're into React or Node.js, we focus more directly on those in React Status and Node Weekly respectively, so check out the latest issues of those too¬†:-)

„Äë
